summary: The nature category encompasses resources related to the intricate balance of biological ecosystems and their unique biotic and abiotic factors. These ecosystems, defined by their specific space and time, can also describe modern, decentralized organizational structures. This interdisciplinary approach emphasizes resilience and organic growth.
excerpt: Biological ecosystems are specific to space and time, but the term ecosystem has been broadened to describe non-natural organizations, underscoring a shift towards organic, decentralized structures.
